summary: This adds additional weapons and shields to NPCs in the game to make them have a "Geared Up" look. They carry shields on their backs and additional weapons at their sides. It also many 3-4 new colour variations for villagers and townspeople. Adds to immersion by providing random equipment. Script free. Check pictures to see what it does.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][color=#D2980A]Description[/color]
[/size]
True Grit is a name I will be using to release some of my personal game-play mods that mainly alter the variation in NPCs.
This mod is a part of a larger .esp I use to make tweaks to my game, I have decided to start breaking apart that personal .esp and releasing pieces of it.

[color=#D2980A]Latest Update 14th May 2016[/color]

[list]
[*]Weapons and Clothing have been split into seperate modules, also added three demonstration videos
[/list]
[line]
[size=5][color=#D2980A]Weapons Module[/color]
[/size]
[center]
[img]https://dc224aff-a-62cb3a1a-s-sites.googlegroups.com/site/porkbunsyum/elder-scrolls/true-grit-mods/banner.jpg[/img][/center][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]This adds additional weapons and shields to NPCs in the game to make them have a "Geared Up" look[/size]
[*][size=2]They carry shields on their backs and additional weapons at their sides[/size]
[*][size=2]Adds to immersion by providing random equipment. Script free. Check pictures to see what it does.[/size]
[*][size=2]Currently the following groups have the random equipment added: Bandits, Town Guards, Stormcloaks, Imperials, Forsworn, Dawnguard, Housecarls, Thalmor, Mages, and all NPCs that use Steel, Iron, Leather, Fur armours[/size]
[/list][list]
[*][size=2]You can kill any of the NPCs wearing this equipment and use it for yourself[/size]
[*][size=2]It is simply for immersion and role-playing so they don't add any benefits and don't sell for much[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][color=#D2980A][size=5]Clothing Module
[/size]
[img]https://sites.google.com/site/porkbunsyum/elder-scrolls/true-grit-mods/clothes_banner.png[/img][/color][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]All villagers and townspeople now have colour variations of clothing[/size]
[*][size=2]I also randomised their item lists to that ... wait for it ... they actually change clothes over time![/size]
[/list]

[line]
[size=5][color=#D2980A]Prerequisites[/color]
[/size]
[size=4][list]
[*][size=2]This requires all DLC (Legendary Edition of Skyrim) - Edits are made to Dawnguard and Dragonborn Armours and Weapons[/size]
[/list][/size]
[line]
[size=5][color=#D2980A]Installation[/color][/size]

[list]
[*][size=2]Use Nexus Mod Manager, anything else and you are on your own.[/size]
[/list]
[line]

[size=5][color=#D2980A]Troubleshooting[/color]
[/size]
[list]
[*]This edits the default outfit lists in the game, if you have another mod that does the same thing just make sure this mod is "lower" in your load order
[/list]
[line]
